results.title: The Stolen generation: one man's story (A)
results.brief_description: Brian Morley, Aboriginal singer/song writer, is searching for his “Dreamtime”. In 1960, at the age of two, along with his baby sister Jennifer and his older brother Shane, Brian was removed from the care of his natural mother in Dimboola by police and welfare and taken to the Turana Children’s Home in Melbourne. This is the story of Brian’s experiences growing up with a white adopted family, the long-term effects of being removed from his mother and separated from his brother and sister, and the search in his adulthood to find his family and define his Aboriginality. Brian eloquently relates his story in his own words and through his music, expressing hope for the future of all Australians and Australia. Narrated by Andy Johns. Teacher notes included.

results.title: The Stolen children = Il Ladro di bambini
results.creator_credit: Gianni Amelio, Angelo Rizzoli, Raidue, Alia Film and Erre Produzioni
results.brief_description: Two children, Rosetta and Giusseppe are victims of a child prostitution ring. After their mother is arrested, they are taken by Antonio the Carabiniere from the North to the South of Italy, looking for an orphanage that will take the children. The children have learned to trust no-one, not even each other, yet this journey with Antonio begins to break down the barriers that the children have always had to maintain. This very special, rewarding film was the winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 1992 Cannes Film Festival and has been universally hailed as one of the finest Italian films released in many years. Stars Enrico Lo Verso, Valentina Scalici and Giuseppe Ieracitano.

results.title: The Sting [DVD]
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Julia Phillips, Michael S Phillips, Tony Bill and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Johnny Hooker (Robert Redford) is a small time con-man working the backstreets of 1930s Chicago. When his partner is killed by mob boss Doyle Lonnegan, he teams up with down-and-out career criminal Henry Gondorff (Paul Newman), to dupe Lonnegan out of more than half a million dollars. The definitive ‘caper’ movie, “The Sting” features legendary ragtime piano by Scott Joplin and a superb supporting cast including Charles Durning, Eileen Brennan and Robert Shaw.

results.title: The Still Point
results.brief_description: Sarah, (Nadine Garner), a 15-year-old girl, who has a hearing impairment, is entering a crisis period in her life. Her future depends on the ability to emerge from the sheltered world her mother has created for her. In doing this she puts aside the self-imposed isolation of her deafness, and learns the value of her own identity.

results.title: The Stepford wives (1975) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bryan Forbes, Edgar J. Scherick, Fadsin Cinema Associates and Palomar Pictures International
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Ira Levin, the chilling and controversial story of “The Stepford wives” has become a cult classic with its cutting social commentary and chauvinistic/mysognystic themes. It is a tale of perfection, where perfect housewives dutifully serve their husbands and family in domestic bliss in their perfect homes in the sanitised but perfect suburb of Stepford. But something is horribly wrong. Why do all the Stepford men belong to the mysterious Stepford Men’s Club and why do all the women appear to look and behave in the same manner - vacant and robotic? Is there a strange conspiracy going on in the village of Stepford? This very 70s film features Katharine Ross, Paula Prentiss, Peter Masterson, Nanette Newman and Patick O’Neal with screenplay by William Goldman.

results.title: The Stepfather
results.creator_credit: Joseph Ruben, Jay Benson and ITC Productions
results.brief_description: Terry O’Quinn is “the Stepfather”, the man with the generic name because he has been a stepfather many times. He also has a gruesome way of ending relationships and severing the family ties; he kills them when they fail to meet his perfect standards and moves on to the next family. Shelley Hack and Jill Schoelen are cast as his latest victims.

results.title: The Steam-driven adventures of Riverboat Bill (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Based on the Riverboat Bill books by Cliff Green. Riverboat Bill and young Dave Freshwater restore an old paddle-steamer, and, along with a fire breathing Bunyip and Black Ben the Pirate, have many adventures sailing the Murray River.

results.title: The Steam-driven adventures of Riverboat Bill
results.creator_credit: Paul Williams, Film Victoria and Phantascope
results.brief_description: Based on the Riverboat Bill books by Cliff Green. Riverboat Bill and young Dave Freshwater restore an old paddle-steamer, and, along with a fire breathing Bunyip and Black Ben the Pirate, have many adventures sailing the Murray River. Frank Thring Jr as the Bunyip’s voice.

results.title: The Staunch tin soldier
results.brief_description: A puppet film for children based on the fairy tale by Hans Christian Anderson. Tin soldiers are cast and appear among the other toys on the birthday table. At night the toys come to life and the staunch tin soldier who has only one leg, falls in love with the little dancer.
